channel.title: Running unmodified client in a window?
channel.description:
Okay so would it be possible to run an instance of runescape in your own window without editing the client in some way?
Ideally I would want to do this in C++ but the language is not really relevant, I just want to start up an instance and display it and from there pump input into it.
Would JNI be an option? I know you can get fields and such but can it start up a java application instance?

item.title: Running unmodified client in a window?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You can do this from C++, for an example, you could have a look at SMART:

GitHub

BenLand100/SMART

SMART Minimizing Autoing Resource Thing --- A tool to run the RuneScape Client in a sandbox

For an example of how to do it in Java, you could have a look at Cherokee:
http://cherokeeengine.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/cherokeeengine/

Basically, the C++ approach is just a wrapper around the Java approach, it starts up the same code, which has the purpose to load the runescape applet pretending to be a web browser and puts it into a window.

Read full topic
item.source: Running unmodified client in a window?
